long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: ascii -o outputs garbage when ascii 3.8 is used.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): ascii.x86_64 3.8-8.fc22
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. run ascii -o 2. 3.
Actual results: 0 NUL 20 DLE 40 60 0 100 @ 120 P 140 ` 160 p 1 SOH 21 DC1 41 ! 61 1 101 A 121 Q 141 a 161 q 2 STX 22 DC2 42 " 62 2 102 B 122 R 142 b 162 r 3 ETX 23 DC3 43 # 63 3 103 C 123 S 143 c 163 s 4 EOT 24 DC4 44 $ 64 4 104 D 124 T 144 d 164 t 5 ENQ 25 NAK 45 % 65 5 105 E 125 U 145 e 165 u 6 ACK 26 SYN 46 & 66 6 106 F 126 V 146 f 166 v 7 BEL 27 ETB 47 ' 67 7 107 G 127 W 147 g 167 w 10 BS 30 CAN 50 ( 70 8 110 H 130 X 150 h 170 x 11 HTTAB 31 EM 51 ) 71 9 111 I 131 Y 151 i 171 y 12 LFNL 32 SUB 52 * 72 : 112 J 132 Z 152 j 172 z 13 VT 33 ESC 53 + 73 ; 113 K 133 [Left Square Bracket 153 k 173 {Left Curly Bracket 14 FF 34 FS 54 , 74 < 114 L 134 \ 154 l 174 |Vertical Line 15 CR 35 GS 55 - 75 = 115 M 135 ] 155 m 175 }Right Curly Bracket 16 SO 36 RS 56 . 76 > 116 N 136 ^ 156 n 176 ~ 17 SI 37 US 57 / 77 ? 117 O 137 _ 157 o 177 DEL
Expected results: 0 NUL 20 DLE 40 60 0 100 @ 120 P 140 ` 160 p 1 SOH 21 DC1 41 ! 61 1 101 A 121 Q 141 a 161 q 2 STX 22 DC2 42 " 62 2 102 B 122 R 142 b 162 r 3 ETX 23 DC3 43 # 63 3 103 C 123 S 143 c 163 s 4 EOT 24 DC4 44 $ 64 4 104 D 124 T 144 d 164 t 5 ENQ 25 NAK 45 % 65 5 105 E 125 U 145 e 165 u 6 ACK 26 SYN 46 & 66 6 106 F 126 V 146 f 166 v 7 BEL 27 ETB 47 ' 67 7 107 G 127 W 147 g 167 w 10 BS 30 CAN 50 ( 70 8 110 H 130 X 150 h 170 x 11 HT 31 EM 51 ) 71 9 111 I 131 Y 151 i 171 y 12 LF 32 SUB 52 * 72 : 112 J 132 Z 152 j 172 z 13 VT 33 ESC 53 + 73 ; 113 K 133 [ 153 k 173 { 14 FF 34 FS 54 , 74 < 114 L 134 \ 154 l 174 | 15 CR 35 GS 55 - 75 = 115 M 135 ] 155 m 175 } 16 SO 36 RS 56 . 76 > 116 N 136 ^ 156 n 176 ~ 17 SI 37 US 57 / 77 ? 117 O 137 _ 157 o 177 DEL
Additional info: The latest ascii 3.15 from http://www.catb.org/~esr/ascii output is as expected.

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.
If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug.
Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
Fedora 24 still uses the same flawed 3,8 version.
ascii-3.15-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-1b993a64b2
ascii-3.15-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-aab71f11c3
ascii-3.15-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-e497788beb

ascii-3.15-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-1b993a64b2

ascii-3.15-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-e497788beb

ascii-3.15-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-aab71f11c3
ascii-3.15-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
ascii-3.15-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
ascii-3.15-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
